newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela's Amuay sees catcracker fixed in 3 weeks.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela's Amuay sees catcracker fixed in 3 weeks.

text.p: Technical problems with a catalytic cracker at Venezuelan state-owned oil company PdVSA affiliate Lagoven's 510,000 barrels per day Amuay refinery will be fixed in some three weeks, Lagoven said.
The company said in a press release it was "making the necessary arrangements with clients to cover promised export sales." Sales for the internal market would be met from local reserves, it added.
A Lagoven spokeman said he could not immediately comment on the types of arrangements that would be used to cover export contracts.
Venezuela is the U.S.'s top foreign oil supplier shipping some 48,000 bpd of gasoline over the first half of the year, according to U.S. Department of Energy figures.
Amauy's cracker unit went down Sunday after problems with an air compressor. The unit last failed in July, with international deliveries met from reserves while it was fixed.
